Permendikbud Soal KKM Jadi Landasan Orang Tua Gugat SMA Gonzaga
05 Nov 2019, 03:04 by M Yusuf Manurung, Clara Maria Tjandra Dewi H.
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kuasa hukum orang tua murid yang anaknya tak naik kelas di SMA Gonzaga, Susanto Utama, mengatakan sekolah telah melanggar Permendikbud Nomor 53. Peraturan Menteri Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan Nomor 53 tahun 2013 itu mengatur tentang penilaian hasil belajar oleh pendidikan dan satuan pendidikan pada Pendidikan Dasar dan Pendidikan Menengah.
Peraturan yang juga mengatur KKM atau kriteria ketuntasan minimal itu menjadi alasan sekolah tidak menaikkan siswa berinisial BB ke kelas 12.
Menurut Susanto, keputusan SMA Gonzaga justru bertentangan dengan isi Permendikbud Nomor 53.
"Peraturan itu mengatakan bahwa siswa tidak naik kelas kalau dia memiliki nilai merah 3. Sedangkan BB ini dari awal masuk sekolah sampai dengan semester 11 hanya satu merahnya, nilai Sejarah," kata dia di Pengadilan Negeri Jakarta Selatan, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Putra dari Yustina Supatmi itu diketahui mendapatkan nilai 68 dalam mata pelajaran Sejarah. Sementara skor KKM adalah 75 sehingga sekolah memutuskan BB tidak naik kelas.
Susanto juga menuding SMA Kolese Gonzaga tidak pernah melakukan sosialisasi ihwal KKM versi sekolah kepada orang tua murid. Versi yang dimaksud adalah satu nilai merah bisa menyebabkan anak tinggal kelas.
"Sehingga itulah yang kami merasa perlu diuji di muka persidangan," kata dia.
Namun kuasa hukum SMA Kolese Gonzaga, Edi Danggur menyatakan kliennya sudah mensosialisasikan aturan KKM kepada orang tua murid. Dia juga berujar bahwa Yustina Supatmi selaku penggugat salah menafsirkan Permendikbud Nomor 53 itu.
"Sekolah boleh menentukan, satu saja yang tidak tuntas, siswa itu bisa tidak naik kelas," kata dia.
Yustina menggugat SMA Kolese Gonzaga ke Pengadilan Negeri Jakarta Selatan karena dianggap melalukan perbuatan melawan hukum.
Dalam kasus ini, empat orang menjadi tergugat yakni Pater Paulus Andri Astanto menjabat sebagai kepala sekolah; Himawan Santanu sebagai Wakil Kepala Sekolah Bidang Kurikulum; Gerardus Hadian Panomokta sebagai Wakil Kepala Sekolah Bidang Kesiswaan; dan Agus Dewa Irianto sebagai pengajar Sosiologi Kelas XI.
Dalam gugatannya, Yustina Supatmi menilai keputusan para tergugat yang memutuskan anaknya tidak berhak melanjutkan proses belajar ke jenjang kelas 12 SMA Gonzaga adalah cacat hukum. Dia meminta hakim menyatakan anaknya memenuhi syarat dan berhak untuk melanjutkan proses belajar ke jenjang kelas 12 di SMA Kolese Gonzaga. Yustina juga meminta hakim menghukum para tergugat membayar ganti rugi materiil Rp 51.683.000 dan immateril Rp 500 juta.

The Minister of Education and Culture Regulation on KKM Becomes a Base for Gonzaga High School Parents
05 Nov 2019, 03:04 by M Yusuf Manurung, Clara Maria Tjandra Dewi H.
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The legal counsel of parents of children whose children did not graduate in Gonzaga High School, Susanto Utama, said the school violated Permendikbud No. 53. Minister of Education and Culture Regulation No. 53 of 2013 regulates the assessment of learning outcomes by education and units education in Basic Education and Secondary Education.
The regulation that also regulates KKM or minimum completeness criteria is the reason schools don't raise students with the initials BB to 12th grade.
According to Susanto, Gonzaga High School's decision was contrary to the contents of Permendikbud No. 53.
"The regulation says that a student does not go up to class if he has a red score of 3. While this BB from the beginning of entering school until semester 11 only one red, the value of History," he said in the South Jakarta District Court, Monday, November 4, 2019.
The son of Yustina Supatmi is known to have scored 68 in the history subject. While the KKM score is 75 so the school decides BB does not move up the class.
Susanto also accused Gonzaga College High School of never having socialized the school version of KKM regarding parents. The version in question is a red value can cause children to stay class.
"So that is what we feel needs to be tested before the trial," he said.
However, Gonzaga College's attorney, Edi Danggur, said his client had socialized the KKM rules to parents of students. He also said that Yustina Supatmi as the plaintiff misinterpreted Permendikbud No. 53.
"Schools may determine, even if one is incomplete, the student may not move up the class," he said.
Yustina sued Gonzaga College High School to the South Jakarta District Court for allegedly committing an act against the law.
In this case, four people were named as defendants Paulus Andri Astanto who served as the principal; Himawan Santanu as Deputy Principal for Curriculum; Gerardus Hadian Panomokta as Deputy Principal for Student Affairs; and Agus Dewa Irianto as a lecturer in Class XI Sociology.
In her lawsuit, Yustina Supatmi assessed that the decision of the defendants who decided their children were not entitled to continue the process of learning to the 12th grade of Gonzaga High School was legally flawed. He asked the judge to say his son was eligible and had the right to continue the learning process to the 12th grade at Gonzaga College High School. Yustina also asked the judge to punish the defendants to pay material damages of Rp. 51,683,000 and immaterial Rp. 500 million.
